User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15

Using DSLReports Speed Test, FF RC 4 reports 2.8 MBS down (ADSL) while IE 9, Chrome 11, and FF 3.6 report 4.8+. Running Windows 7 64-bit, fully patched. This is consistent with or without extensions enabled. Reset FF4 RC to default settings did not help either.   

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Compare browsers at any internet speed test site. 
2.
3.



No themes, new install, reproducible.
comments.creator: jsayer@dslextreme.com

comments.raw_text:
>Using DSLReports Speed Tes
URL ?
That the download speed in one test is lower doesn't mean that that the download speed of FF4 is lower.

comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de

comments.text:
http://www.dslreports.com/speedtest
http://www.speedtest.net

Repeated over several days. Peek hours and non peak hours. Ongoing problem. Does not affect FF 3.6 only FF 4.0 RC1.
comments.author: jsayer@dslextreme.com

comments.author: josh@joshmatthews.net
comments.text:
Jim, if this is consistent as you say, could you try out the various 4.0 releases [1] and see if you observe a release in which the number changes?  Try starting with 4.0b1 - if you still see the problem there, we can look for older releases.

[1] ftp://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/
comments.raw_text:

comments.creator: jsayer@dslextreme.com
comments.author: jsayer@dslextreme.com
comments.text:
FF RC 1 is all the information I have (4.0 in 'about' box, checking for updates and none were found.)
I ran download speed tests again tonight. Results were consistent across the other three browsers at approximately 4.5 mb/s. FF 4.0 was approximately 1.4 mb/s slower and consistently so. average ping was 21 ms.

I hope this helps
